ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] RE: Why did you start a Bard (long winded look at t he good old da ys)
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh...on Howard Stern, he sometimes plays the outtake of Casey Casem going off because of someone s song choice after a death dedication, and he says that.
ygData.messageBody:
Heh...on Howard Stern, he sometimes plays the outtake of Casey Casem going
off because of someone's song choice after a death dedication, and he says
that. That's where the word has weaseled it's way into my vocabulary from.
:)

-----Original Message-----
From: Gordon Hughes [mailto:ghughes@...]
Sent: Friday, January 12, 2001 10:47 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] RE: Why did you start a Bard (long winded look at
t he good old da ys)


Wasn't that the name of a song?

"... this is ponderous man, really... ponderous."

Friday! It's nearly next week.

And I just ate a stale bagel. *ptooey!*

>
There is nothing more ponderous than a High Elf cleric in full
bronze...except maybe a bard with broken drums...

Ponderous...ponderous...
>
